title: Digital Workplace Endpoint Management Architect
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your Role and Your Team  
As part of the Digital Workplace team, you will be accountable for designing, implementing, and running Lilium’s endpoint platforms, services, and solutions.  
Our IT team enables our business with flexible, scalable, fit-for-purpose and secure IT solutions, covering all areas from Endpoint Management, Identity and Access Management, Connectivity, Cloud platform engineering as well as highly secure, high performance and reliable datacenter services.  
Your Day to Day  

Define the Endpoint Management service strategy and it´s technical architecture 
You are responsible for the maintenance and further development of our company-wide operating system deployment as well as our client, server, and mobile endpoints 


This includes upgrade and patch management as well as distribution of software 
You take a leading role in all endpoint management projects 
Technical coaching of team members in your area 
You oversee device enrollment, registering new devices and troubleshoot device issues 
Also, you are responsible for overall planning, provision, operation, and further development of Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI), SCCM & Intune on a global scale 
Provide international 2nd, and 3rd Level Support, as well as documentation of the Digital Workplace Services 


Stay current with best practices for continuous integration and delivery 
Collaborate with internal teams such as Cyber Security, Global IT and Business to assess requirements and propose robust and efficient solutions 
Responsible for developing, maintaining and operating procedures and user guides  

Your Profile  

Bachelor’s degree in technology or computer science, or similar working experience 


5-7 years' experience in managing endpoints with SCCM & Intune 
Good knowledge of PowerShell and PowerShell modules 
Basic knowledge of Linux and client networking 
Experience or strong knowledge with ITIL framework 
Analytical and problem-solving skills 


Strong attention to detail and expert follow-up skills 
You can work in teams that consist of several nationalities and cultures 
Ability to work in a highly energetic, dynamic, and fast-moving environment 
High level of self-reliance with the ability to work in a team, as well as autonomously 
Fluent in English, spoken and written. German is a big plus 

Certifications, Not Required but Helpful  

Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate  
ITIL 4 Foundation 

 
#LI-AC1Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
